oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Negro History Week and Masonic History Days Presenting John Wesley Dobbs

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Advertisement for "Negro History Week and Masonic History Day." The Honorable John Wesley Dobbs will speak. An image of John Wesley Dobbs is included on the broadside.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Fraternal organizations; Fraternal lodges; Civil rights leaders
Broadsides; Dobbs, John Wesley, 1882-1961; Masons (Secret order); Walker, James T.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Darden's Printing Co.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John Wesley Dobbs (1882-1961) founded a number of civil rights organizations in Atlanta in the 1930s and 1940s. He was a family friend of Martin Luther King and a Master Mason.
